etymology.description: semantic 艹(艹) (cǎo, "grass") + phonetic 叔(叔) (shū, "uncle") = plant similar to grasses -> pulse
etymology.interpretation: The character 菽(shū, "pulse") combines the 艹(艹) (cǎo, "grass") radical to indicate its association with plants, together with the phonetic component 叔(叔) (shū, "uncle") to suggest pronunciation. This reflects the character's meaning related to legumes, which are a type of plant.

examples.chinese: 这道菜以菽为主料(這道菜以菽為主料)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè dào cài yǐ shū wéi zhǔliào.
examples.english: This dish is primarily made with pulses.

examples.chinese: 农家秋日采菽(農家秋日採菽)，制成美味豆粥(製成美味豆粥)。
examples.pinyin: Nóngjiā qiūrì cǎi shū, zhì chéng měiwèi dòuzhōu.
examples.english: In autumn, country folk harvest pulses to make delicious bean porridge.
